p: The Brazilian Cerrado (savannah) comprises hundreds of plant species that show potential use and feasibility for economic and therapeutic exploitation. Several of these species are used by local populations to treat various diseases that affect humans and animals. One of these medicinal plants is Pterodon emarginatus (Fabaceae), also called ‘‘sucupira’’ or ‘‘faveiro’’ that is distributed throughout central Brazil, in the states of Goiás, Minas Gerais and São Paulo.
